Thought for 22 seconds

The user is asking for a brief clinical diagnosis based on the details provided, which include potential metastatic melanoma, lung issues, and immune-related complications. The clinical diagnosis could be metastatic melanoma recurrence with pulmonary nodules, possibly complicated by infections or pneumonitis. The final diagnosis, after biopsy, might confirm organizing pneumonia or checkpoint inhibitor pneumonitis, linked to pembrolizumab therapy. I'll reference the NEJM case "16-2020" for further verification of this diagnosis.
